comments: 5-10 dependent on homework set

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Very good summary of ethical issues faced in epi research. The guest lecturers were well-chosen and the topics were relevant.
Fabulous ethics course, great to listen to Chris, as always.
Helpful course

Strengths: Practical information about the research process that I haven't formally received in other courses/seminars. Some of the seminars made me think hard about ethical issues -- especially the lecture by Dr. Khoshnood.Areas for improvement: I think most of us already knew everything covered in the IRB lecture, so it would have been nice to have a more applied lecture - thinking more about potential problems that may arise and how we would go about dealing with those situations (as opposed to an overview of the IRB as an organization).
Great overview of ethics topics - much more interesting than I expected.
It was a great time to learn about research ethics.

I enjoyed this course because I initially feared that it would be a rehash of other required ethics classes that I have taken. This wasn't really the case as we touched upon various topics related to ethics that we may come across as doctoral students. I would make the class a little more discussion based rather than lecture format.
This course had the potential to be very interesting, but I thought some of the guest lecturers (despite the tremendous amount of experience they had) were quite boring.
Good
for an ethics class at 9 am , i thought it was great! Guest lecturers were at the top of their field and Dr. Tschudi's lectures were informative and interesting
A good opportunity to think proactively about issues we may encounter as researchers.
The topics are carefully chosen and it is critically important for every graduate student doing research.
The topics discussed were all very useful. I especially appreciated the discussion on reviewing manuscripts and grant applications.
excellent

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Christian Tschudi  Dr. Tschudi was able to emphasize the seriousness of professional and ethical conduct, while remaining friendly and approachable.
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  Great stories, honest insight.
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  great lecturer, though did not find as helpful one on one
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  He is good.
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  Wonderful. I especially appreciated his candidness about ethical issues in the peer review process and grant review process.
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  Chris Tschudi is very receptive to student needs and made himself accessible for questions and student feedback.
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  Strengths: dynamic speaker, very knowledgeableWeakness: none
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  I realize the material to be covered is quite dry, but there must be some way to make it more interesting.
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  Good
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  Great.
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  Dr. Tschudi was great at communicating the main issues we needed to be considerate of, and provided great examples of each.
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  The professor is patient, supportive, available and inquisitive about his student's interests and always helps students when they need it.
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  Dr. Tschudi is awesome!

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend this course to another student.
Intro to ethics/ discussion of the review process.
I would recommend the course to a fellow student.
great class if you are looking to learn R
Useful!
Required course for doctoral students, very low key, but I definitely learned from it and recommend paying attention.
A half semester course focusing on important ethical issues that arise in the realm of conducting research in the "lab" and outside the "lab".
This is a required course that all M.S. and PhD students have to take
This is a required course.
Good
good class. went over a lot and learned things that i didn't know during the lectures
Yes, I will
